repository.corpname: George J. Mitchell Department of Special Collections & Archives, Bowdoin College Library, Brunswick, Maine 04011

did.abstract: Materials relating to Donald Baxter MacMillan's expeditions to arctic regions including diaries; journals and logs, including those used for the Peary North Pole expedition and the Crocker Land expedition; correspondence; writings; and adresses.

relatedmaterial.head: Related materials
relatedmaterial.p: For related collections at Bowdoin College see: MacMillan "Thebaud" Collection; the Miriam MacMillan Collection; the MacMillan-Snyder letters; the MacMillan-Morse Collection; and the holdings of the Peary-MacMillan Arctic Museum.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Note
bioghist.p: Donald Baxter MacMillan was born November 10, 1874, in Provincetown, Massachusetts, the younger son of Captain Neil MacMillan and Sarah Gardner MacMillan, a shipbuilder's daughter. After receiving his degree from Bowdoin in 1898, MacMillan served as principal of Levi Hall School in North Gorham, Maine (1898-1900). He later taught at Swarthmore Preparatory School in Swarthmore, Pennsylvania (1900-1903), and at Worcester Academy in Worcester, Massachusetts (1903-1908).

MacMillan's correspondence with Admiral Robert E. Peary (Bowdoin 1877) led to his becoming an assistant to the arctic explorer on his expedition to the North Pole (1908-1909). An accident, however, prevented MacMillan from reaching the pole himself, a goal he never realized except by plane.

Over his lifetime MacMillan would make over thirty expeditions to the far North on the schooner Bowdoin, conducting important work in the fields of botany, ornithology, meteorology, and anthropology. Many of these trips he made with his wife, Miriam Look, whom he married in 1935. Together they led several crews of faculty and students (many from Bowdoin) on expeditions into the arctic between 1935 and 1954.

In addition to his arctic expeditions, MacMillan lectured throughout the United States and wrote several books, including Four Years in the White North (1918), Etah and Beyond (1927), and How Peary Reached the Pole (1934). He also served in the U.S. Navy as Lieutenant (1918-1919), Commander (1941-1945), and Rear Admiral (1954); was Tallman Professor of Anthropology at Bowdoin (1932-1933); and was awarded the F.R.G.S. Special Congressional Medal in 1944. He received honorary degrees from Bowdoin (1918) and Boston University (1937) and was educated at Harvard from 1911-1913. He died on September 7, 1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection includes diaries, journals and logs (1902-1961), including those used for the Peary expedition (1908-1909) and the Crocker Land expedition (1913-1915); correspondence; manuscript drafts for Four Years in the White North (1918), How Peary reached the Pole: The Personal Story of His Assistant Donald B. MacMillan (1934), and Green Seas and White Ice (1948); addresses, lectures and articles (1897-1931 and undated); lecture schedules and lists (1924-1960); miscellaneous manuscripts; documents (1839-1969); photographs; and maps and charts. Principal correspondents include Robert E. Peary, Robert M. Cross, Charles Cabot Easton, Alfred H. Fenton, Bela W. Norton, Harry L. Palmer, and Clifton A. Towle.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Donald Baxter MacMillan Collection, George J. Mitchell Department of Special Collections & Archives, Bowdoin College Library, Brunswick, Maine.

odd.head: Sponsor
odd.p: Digitization of materials related to the Crocker Land Expedition generously funded by the Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation, 2016.

scopecontent.head: Series Description:
scopecontent.p: This series contains correspondence 1884-1970, n.d.; a separate run of correspondence from MacMillan to Clifton A. Towle dating 1908-1933, n.d.; biographical data; and descriptions of MacMillan literary, photographic, and documentary material.

Literary Manuscripts by Donald Baxter MacMillan, 1921-1943, n.d.

scopecontent.head: Series Description:
scopecontent.p: This series contains manuscripts and typescripts of books written by MacMillan, including "Four Years in the White North" (1918); "Etah and Beyond" (1927); "How Peary Reached the Pole" (1934); several unpublished works; and several translation dictionaries of Eskimo languages. Some manuscripts are incomplete.

Literary Manuscripts about MacMillan and the Arctic, 1948-1962, n.d.

scopecontent.head: Series Description:
scopecontent.p: This series contains manuscripts and typescripts about MacMillan and the arctic. Included are a biography by Allen Everett; three books written by MacMillan's wife, Miriam Macmillan; and a book on native Greenland language.

scopecontent.head: Series Description:
scopecontent.p: This series contains manuscripts and typescripts of radio addresses and lectures given by MacMillan. It also contains manuscripts and typescripts for various articles written by MacmIllan. Also included are lecture schedules.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials:
relatedmaterial.p: Additional volumes related to the Crocker Land expedition are in the Miriam MacMillan papers (M119), Maruice C. Tanguary papers (M328), and Walter E. Ekblaw papers (M327). Journals from the Crocker Land Expedition have been digitized and are accessible through the links in the finding aid. Digitization of materials related to Crocker Land Expedition funded by the Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation, 2016.

scopecontent.head: Series Description:
scopecontent.p: This series contains diaries, journals, field notes, log books, and various notebooks from throughout MacMillan's career. This includes journals from the Peary North Pole Expedition of 1908-1909, the Crocker Land Expedition of 1913-1917, and for his various expeditions to Labrador, Greenland, and other Arctic destinations. There are also diaries and journals of other members of MacMillan's expeditions.

scopecontent.head: Series Description:
scopecontent.p: This series contains typescript and photocopies of various diaries and journals belonging to MacMillan regarding the Peary North Pole Expedition, the Crocker Land Expedition, or relating to arctic exploration more generally.

scopecontent.head: Series Description:
scopecontent.p: This series contains newspaper clippings, various manuscript and typescript notes and articles, and other ephemera. Within this series are clippings and articles concerning the Peary/Cook controversy, scrapbooks and photo albums; posters and press releases; certificates and awards; a run of mounted plant specimens from Labrador; and other miscellaneous ephemera and realia.

scopecontent.head: Series Description:
scopecontent.p: This series contains notecards for English to Inuit and Inuit to English translations.

scopecontent.head: Series Description:
scopecontent.p: This series includes photos of MacMillan at Bowdoin, many images of the schooner "Bowdoin," a few expedition photos, and various photos of MacMillan and others.
